name: blast
content:
blast verb
(EXPLODE, HIT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] to explode or destroy something or someone with explosives, or to break through or hit something with a similar, very strong force: An explosion blasted through the wall. They blasted tunnels into the side of the mountain. He saw what he thought was a grizzly bear and blasted it with his rifle. See also
sandblast
More examplesFewer examplesGuerrillas blasted a hole in the outer wall of the embassy compound. Perhaps a giant impact blasted away part of the earth's crust. They blast pheasants out of the sky with their shotguns.The two teams turn their paint guns on each other and blast away.The defender blasted the ball from 25 metres away.
